media:group.media:title: BROTHERS
media:group.media:description:
When 27-year old Nick Chisholm collapsed from a stroke, his brother Matt was there for him. For the past 20 years, Nick’s had a rare and severe case of locked-in syndrome – unable to walk or to speak, but Matt has been by his side for his rehab, his love story, and for the latest surprise – a special gift that no one ever saw coming.
Reporter: Matt Chisholm Producer: Joanne Mitchell Cameras: Joseph Day, Gary Hopper Editors: Gareth Pearce, Stuart Robertson

media:group.media:title: Good Sorts: An immigrant’s story: Meet the man who came to New Zealand from India 70 years ago
media:group.media:description:
Manu Lala dreamed of getting a flash job in a big city but he’s now famous for running the only shop in one of NZ’s smallest towns.
